title: Jnana Vijnana Yoga
subtitle: The Yoga of Knowledge and Wisdom
summary: In Chapter 7, Lord Krishna reveals His divine glories and explains the nature of the Supreme Reality. He describes two aspects of existence - the higher (divine) and lower (material) natures, and how everything emanates from Him. Krishna explains that most people worship Him in various forms without understanding His supreme nature, but rare are those who know Him as the source of all creation. He concludes by emphasizing that true wisdom is knowing Him as the Supreme Truth.

verses.sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच | मय्यासक्तमनाः पार्थ योगं युञ्जन्मदाश्रयः | असंशयं समग्रं मां यथा ज्ञास्यसि तच्छृणु ||
verses.transliteration: śrī bhagavān uvāca | mayy āsakta-manāḥ pārtha yogaṃ yuñjan mad-āśrayaḥ | asaṃśayaṃ samagraṃ māṃ yathā jñāsyasi tac chṛṇu ||
verses.translation: The Blessed Lord said: O Partha, hear how you shall know Me completely, without doubt, by practicing yoga with your mind fixed on Me and taking refuge in Me.
verses.explanation: Krishna promises Arjuna complete knowledge of the Supreme Truth through devoted yoga practice.

verses.sanskrit: ज्ञानं तेऽहं सविज्ञानमिदं वक्ष्याम्यशेषतः | यज्ज्ञात्वा नेह भूयोऽन्यज्ज्ञातव्यमवशिष्यते ||
verses.transliteration: jñānaṃ te 'haṃ sa-vijñānam idaṃ vakṣyāmy aśeṣataḥ | yaj jñātvā neha bhūyo 'nyaj jñātavyam avaśiṣyate ||
verses.translation: I shall now declare to you in full this knowledge combined with wisdom, knowing which nothing further shall remain to be known.
verses.explanation: Krishna is about to reveal complete knowledge that leaves nothing else to be known.

verses.sanskrit: मनुष्याणां सहस्रेषु कश्चिद्यतति सिद्धये | यततामपि सिद्धानां कश्चिन्मां वेत्ति तत्त्वतः ||
verses.transliteration: manuṣyāṇāṃ sahasreṣu kaścid yatati siddhaye | yatatām api siddhānāṃ kaścin māṃ vetti tattvataḥ ||
verses.translation: Among thousands of men, scarcely one strives for perfection; and among those who have achieved perfection, scarcely one knows Me in truth.
verses.explanation: Very few seek spiritual perfection, and among those, even fewer truly know Krishna's essential nature.

verses.sanskrit: भूमिरापोऽनलो वायुः खं मनो बुद्धिरेव च | अहङ्कार इतीयं मे भिन्ना प्रकृतिरष्टधा ||
verses.transliteration: bhūmir āpo 'nalo vāyuḥ khaṃ mano buddhir eva ca | ahaṅkāra itīyaṃ me bhinnā prakṛtir aṣṭadhā ||
verses.translation: Earth, water, fire, air, ether, mind, intellect and ego - these are the eightfold division of My separated material energy.
verses.explanation: Krishna describes His lower (apara) nature consisting of material elements and mental faculties.

verses.sanskrit: अपरेयमितस्त्वन्यां प्रकृतिं विद्धि मे पराम् | जीवभूतां महाबाहो ययेदं धार्यते जगत् ||
verses.transliteration: apareyam itas tv anyāṃ prakṛtiṃ viddhi me parām | jīva-bhūtāṃ mahā-bāho yayedam dhāryate jagat ||
verses.translation: O mighty-armed, besides this inferior nature, know My superior energy - the living beings who sustain this world.
verses.explanation: Krishna reveals His higher (para) nature - the conscious living entities who animate creation.

verses.sanskrit: एतद्योनीनि भूतानि सर्वाणीत्युपधारय | अहं कृत्स्नस्य जगतः प्रभवः प्रलयस्तथा ||
verses.transliteration: etad-yonīni bhūtāni sarvāṇīty upadhāraya | ahaṃ kṛtsnasya jagataḥ prabhavaḥ pralayas tathā ||
verses.translation: Know that all beings have these two natures as their source. I am the origin and dissolution of the entire universe.
verses.explanation: All creation emerges from the interaction of Krishna's two energies, and He is the ultimate source.

verses.sanskrit: मत्तः परतरं नान्यत्किञ्चिदस्ति धनञ्जय | मयि सर्वमिदं प्रोतं सूत्रे मणिगणा इव ||
verses.transliteration: mattaḥ parataraṃ nānyat kiñcid asti dhanañjaya | mayi sarvam idaṃ protaṃ sūtre maṇi-gaṇā iva ||
verses.translation: O Dhananjaya, there is nothing superior to Me. Everything rests in Me, as pearls strung on a thread.
verses.explanation: Krishna declares His supreme position - everything exists in relation to Him like jewels on a string.

verses.sanskrit: रसोऽहमप्सु कौन्तेय प्रभास्मि शशिसूर्ययोः | प्रणवः सर्ववेदेषु शब्दः खे पौरुषं नृषु ||
verses.transliteration: raso 'ham apsu kaunteya prabhāsmi śaśi-sūryayoḥ | praṇavaḥ sarva-vedeṣu śabdaḥ khe pauruṣaṃ nṛṣu ||
verses.translation: O son of Kunti, I am the taste in water, the light in the sun and moon, the sacred syllable Om in all Vedas, sound in ether, and ability in humans.
verses.explanation: Krishna gives examples of how He is the essential reality behind all experiences.

verses.sanskrit: पुण्यो गन्धः पृथिव्यां च तेजश्चास्मि विभावसौ | जीवनं सर्वभूतेषु तपश्चास्मि तपस्विषु ||
verses.transliteration: puṇyo gandhaḥ pṛthivyāṃ ca tejaś cāsmi vibhāvasau | jīvanaṃ sarva-bhūteṣu tapaś cāsmi tapasviṣu ||
verses.translation: I am the pure fragrance in earth and the brilliance in fire. I am the life in all beings and the austerity in ascetics.
verses.explanation: More examples of Krishna's immanent presence in the world.

verses.sanskrit: बीजं मां सर्वभूतानां विद्धि पार्थ सनातनम् | बुद्धिर्बुद्धिमतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम् ||
verses.transliteration: bījaṃ māṃ sarva-bhūtānāṃ viddhi pārtha sanātanam | buddhir buddhimatām asmi tejas tejasvinām aham ||
verses.translation: O Partha, know Me to be the eternal seed of all beings. I am the intelligence of the intelligent and the splendor of the splendid.
verses.explanation: Krishna is the fundamental source of all existence and the essence of all excellence.

verses.sanskrit: बलं बलवतां चाहं कामरागविवर्जितम् | धर्माविरुद्धो भूतेषु कामोऽस्मि भरतर्षभ ||
verses.transliteration: balaṃ balavatāṃ cāhaṃ kāma-rāga-vivarjitam | dharmāviruddho bhūteṣu kāmo 'smi bharatarṣabha ||
verses.translation: O best of the Bharatas, I am the strength of the strong that is free from desire and passion. In beings I am the desire that is not contrary to dharma.
verses.explanation: Krishna is the pure power in the powerful and the righteous desires in creatures.

verses.sanskrit: ये चैव सात्त्विका भावा राजसास्तामसाश्च ये | मत्त एवेति तान्विद्धि न त्वहं तेषु ते मयि ||
verses.transliteration: ye caiva sāttvikā bhāvā rājasās tāmasāś ca ye | matta eveti tān viddhi na tv ahaṃ teṣu te mayi ||
verses.translation: Know that all states of being - whether in goodness, passion or ignorance - are manifested by My energy. I am in everything, but I am not dependent on them.
verses.explanation: All qualities emerge from Krishna's energies, but He remains transcendental to them.

verses.sanskrit: त्रिभिर्गुणमयैर्भावैरेभिः सर्वमिदं जगत् | मोहितं नाभिजानाति मामेभ्यः परमव्ययम् ||
verses.transliteration: tribhir guṇa-mayair bhāvair ebhiḥ sarvam idaṃ jagat | mohitaṃ nābhijānāti mām ebhyaḥ param avyayam ||
verses.translation: Deluded by these three modes of material nature, the whole world does not recognize Me who am above them and imperishable.
verses.explanation: Most beings are confused by the gunas and fail to perceive Krishna's transcendental nature.

verses.sanskrit: दैवी ह्येषा गुणमयी मम माया दुरत्यया | मामेव ये प्रपद्यन्ते मायामेतां तरन्ति ते ||
verses.transliteration: daivī hy eṣā guṇa-mayī mama māyā duratyayā | mām eva ye prapadyante māyām etāṃ taranti te ||
verses.translation: This divine energy of Mine, consisting of the three modes of nature, is difficult to overcome. But those who surrender unto Me cross beyond it.
verses.explanation: Krishna's Maya (illusion) is powerful, but surrender to Him enables transcendence.

verses.sanskrit: न मां दुष्कृतिनो मूढाः प्रपद्यन्ते नराधमाः | माययापहृतज्ञाना आसुरं भावमाश्रिताः ||
verses.transliteration: na māṃ duṣkṛtino mūḍhāḥ prapadyante narādhamāḥ | māyayāpahṛta-jñānā āsuraṃ bhāvam āśritāḥ ||
verses.translation: The evil-doers, the deluded, the lowest of men, whose knowledge is stolen by illusion, and who partake of the demoniac nature, do not surrender to Me.
verses.explanation: Those dominated by demonic tendencies cannot approach Krishna.

verses.sanskrit: चतुर्विधा भजन्ते मां जनाः सुकृतिनोऽर्जुन | आर्तो जिज्ञासुरर्थार्थी ज्ञानी च भरतर्षभ ||
verses.transliteration: catur-vidhā bhajante māṃ janāḥ sukṛtino 'rjuna | ārto jijñāsur arthārthī jñānī ca bharatarṣabha ||
verses.translation: O best of the Bharatas, four kinds of virtuous men worship Me: the distressed, the seeker of knowledge, the seeker of wealth, and the wise one, O Arjuna.
verses.explanation: Krishna describes four categories of devotees who approach Him.

verses.sanskrit: तेषां ज्ञानी नित्ययुक्त एकभक्तिर्विशिष्यते | प्रियो हि ज्ञानिनोऽत्यर्थमहं स च मम प्रियः ||
verses.transliteration: teṣāṃ jñānī nitya-yukta eka-bhaktir viśiṣyate | priyo hi jñānino 'tyartham ahaṃ sa ca mama priyaḥ ||
verses.translation: Of these, the wise one, ever united with Me and devoted to Me alone, is the best. For I am exceedingly dear to the wise, and he is dear to Me.
verses.explanation: Among devotees, the jnani (wise one) with single-pointed devotion is most dear to Krishna.

verses.sanskrit: उदाराः सर्व एवैते ज्ञानी त्वात्मैव मे मतम् | आस्थितः स हि युक्तात्मा मामेवानुत्तमां गतिम् ||
verses.transliteration: udārāḥ sarva evaite jñānī tv ātmaiva me matam | āsthitaḥ sa hi yuktātmā mām evānuttamāṃ gatim ||
verses.translation: All these devotees are noble, but I regard the wise as My very Self. For with steadfast mind, they are established in Me alone as the supreme goal.
verses.explanation: While all devotees are elevated, the jnani realizes identity with Krishna.

verses.sanskrit: बहूनां जन्मनामन्ते ज्ञानवान्मां प्रपद्यते | वासुदेवः सर्वमिति स महात्मा सुदुर्लभः ||
verses.transliteration: bahūnāṃ janmanām ante jñānavān māṃ prapadyate | vāsudevaḥ sarvam iti sa mahātmā su-durlabhaḥ ||
verses.translation: After many births, the wise man surrenders unto Me, realizing that Vasudeva is all. Such a great soul is very rare.
verses.explanation: After spiritual evolution through lifetimes, rare souls fully surrender to Krishna.

verses.sanskrit: कामैस्तैस्तैर्हृतज्ञानाः प्रपद्यन्तेऽन्यदेवताः | तं तं नियममास्थाय प्रकृत्या नियताः स्वया ||
verses.transliteration: kāmais tais tair hṛta-jñānāḥ prapadyante 'nya-devataḥ | taṃ taṃ niyamam āsthāya prakṛtyā niyatāḥ svayā ||
verses.translation: Those whose wisdom has been carried away by various desires surrender to other gods, following various rites, constrained by their own nature.
verses.explanation: Those distracted by desires worship various deities according to their inclinations.

verses.sanskrit: यो यो यां यां तनुं भक्तः श्रद्धयार्चितुमिच्छति | तस्य तस्याचलां श्रद्धां तामेव विदधाम्यहम् ||
verses.transliteration: yo yo yāṃ yāṃ tanuṃ bhaktaḥ śraddhayārcitum icchati | tasya tasyācalāṃ śraddhāṃ tām eva vidadhāmy aham ||
verses.translation: Whatever form a devotee with faith wishes to worship, I make that faith of his steady.
verses.explanation: Krishna sustains the faith of devotees who worship Him in various forms.

verses.sanskrit: स तया श्रद्धया युक्तस्तस्याराधनमीहते | लभते च ततः कामान्मयैव विहितान्हि तान् ||
verses.transliteration: sa tayā śraddhayā yuktas tasyārādhanam īhate | labhate ca tataḥ kāmān mayaiva vihitān hi tān ||
verses.translation: Endowed with that faith, he seeks to propitiate that deity and obtains his desires, which are in reality granted by Me alone.
verses.explanation: The fruits of such worship actually come from Krishna's sanction.

verses.sanskrit: अन्तवत्तु फलं तेषां तद्भवत्यल्पमेधसाम् | देवान्देवयजो यान्ति मद्भक्ता यान्ति मामपि ||
verses.transliteration: anta-vat tu phalaṃ teṣāṃ tad bhavaty alpa-medhasām | devān deva-yajo yānti mad-bhaktā yānti mām api ||
verses.translation: But the fruit gained by these men of small understanding is perishable. Those who worship the gods go to the gods; My devotees come to Me.
verses.explanation: Worship of lesser deities yields temporary results, while devotion to Krishna leads to Him.

verses.sanskrit: अव्यक्तं व्यक्तिमापन्नं मन्यन्ते मामबुद्धयः | परं भावमजानन्तो ममाव्ययमनुत्तमम् ||
verses.transliteration: avyaktaṃ vyaktim āpannaṃ manyante mām abuddhayaḥ | paraṃ bhāvam ajānanto mamāvyayam anuttamam ||
verses.translation: The unintelligent think of Me, the Unmanifest, as having manifestation, not knowing My higher nature - imperishable and supreme.
verses.explanation: Fools mistake Krishna's temporary manifestations for His ultimate formless reality.

verses.sanskrit: नाहं प्रकाशः सर्वस्य योगमायासमावृतः | मूढोऽयं नाभिजानाति लोको मामजमव्ययम् ||
verses.transliteration: nāhaṃ prakāśaḥ sarvasya yoga-māyā-samāvṛtaḥ | mūḍho 'yaṃ nābhijānāti loko mām ajam avyayam ||
verses.translation: Veiled by My creative power (Yoga-Maya), I am not revealed to all. This deluded world knows Me not - the unborn, imperishable.
verses.explanation: Krishna's true nature is hidden from those under illusion's sway.

verses.sanskrit: वेदाहं समतीतानि वर्तमानानि चार्जुन | भविष्याणि च भूतानि मां तु वेद न कश्चन ||
verses.transliteration: vedāhaṃ samatītāni vartamānāni cārjuna | bhaviṣyāṇi ca bhūtāni māṃ tu veda na kaścana ||
verses.translation: O Arjuna, I know the past, present and future beings, but no one knows Me.
verses.explanation: Krishna is the knower of all temporal existence but remains unknowable by ordinary means.

verses.sanskrit: इच्छाद्वेषसमुत्थेन द्वन्द्वमोहेन भारत | सर्वभूतानि संमोहं सर्गे यान्ति परन्तप ||
verses.transliteration: icchā-dveṣa-samutthena dvandva-mohena bhārata | sarva-bhūtāni saṃmohaṃ sarge yānti parantapa ||
verses.translation: O scion of Bharata, O conqueror of foes, all beings are deluded at birth by the dualities arising from desire and aversion.
verses.explanation: All creatures enter life bewildered by opposing attractions and repulsions.

verses.sanskrit: येषां त्वन्तगतं पापं जनानां पुण्यकर्मणाम् | ते द्वन्द्वमोहनिर्मुक्ता भजन्ते मां दृढव्रताः ||
verses.transliteration: yeṣāṃ tv anta-gataṃ pāpaṃ janānāṃ puṇya-karmaṇām | te dvandva-moha-nirmuktā bhajante māṃ dṛḍha-vratāḥ ||
verses.translation: But those men of virtuous deeds, whose sins have come to an end, freed from the delusion of dualities, worship Me with firm resolve.
verses.explanation: Only those purified of sin and duality can steadfastly worship Krishna.

verses.sanskrit: जरामरणमोक्षाय मामाश्रित्य यतन्ति ये | ते ब्रह्म तद्विदुः कृत्स्नमध्यात्मं कर्म चाखिलम् ||
verses.transliteration: jarā-maraṇa-mokṣāya mām āśritya yatanti ye | te brahma tad viduḥ kṛtsnam adhyātmaṃ karma cākhilam ||
verses.translation: Those who strive for liberation from old age and death, taking refuge in Me, come to know Brahman, the individual self, and all karma in its entirety.
verses.explanation: Devotees seeking liberation gain complete knowledge of ultimate reality.

verses.sanskrit: साधिभूताधिदैवं मां साधियज्ञं च ये विदुः | प्रयाणकालेऽपि च मां ते विदुर्युक्तचेतसः ||
verses.transliteration: sādhi-bhūtādhi-daivaṃ māṃ sādhi-yajñaṃ ca ye viduḥ | prayāṇa-kāle 'pi ca māṃ te vidur yukta-cetasaḥ ||
verses.translation: Those who know Me as governing the physical and divine realms, and all sacrifices, remember Me even at the time of death with steadfast mind.
verses.explanation: Knowing Krishna's all-pervading nature enables remembrance at the crucial moment of death.
